resources.string: Please specify the name of the object!
Enter the name of the object and if you want to additional information
Move your phone slowly during the training in order to train impressions from several perspectives
Amount of samples that are fed to the AI when adding a new object
Please restart the app so that the changes can be applied
Tilt the device a little during training so that the object can be viewed from multiple perspectives in order to improve the recognition rate
Resolution of the sample images that are added to object training
No objects saved for the current object folder yet!
Add a object folder that will learn your objects
Please give your object folder a name!
Please do not change tabs while training! Object will not be saved.
Delete all object folders and objects
Are you sure you want to delete all object folders and objects?
(After reset your data can not be recovered)
object folder is full! Please create a new object folder to add further objects.
An error occurred! Please restart the app to avoid arbitrary behaviour.
A object folder with this name already exists. Please specify another name
An object with this name already exists. Please specify another name
Count down this period of time before training starts

ARORA (Augmented Reality and Object Recognition Application) is an Android application that was developed by Michael Schlosser as part of a project at Aalen University in Germany.

With this application it is possible to train the model for custom objects and mapping them to information and other metadata like their type and additional information. This is made possible by extending an already trained object recognition AI with additional objects using so-called Transfer Learning. This functionality can be applied in various areas such as the tourism industry, Augmented Reality games and many more.

A special thing about this method is that all processing happens on the mobile device without the needs of an external server. This makes it possible to use the application even without internet access.

The object folder used is a MobilenetV2, which has been extended by a configurable Softmax layer. It is possible to change the object folder.

More information about the configuration of a custom object folder can be found here.

The GitHub repository for this application can be found here.

About the author
University email:
michael.schlosser@studmail.htw-aalen.de

After the countdown has expired, impressions of the object are collected. You can continue with the recognition as soon as the text next to the loading circle changed to "Detecting" in the upper right corner
Delete all object folders and objects from the application
Are you sure you want to delete this object?
A threshold from which recognition confidence an object should be marked as correctly recognized

If you are not satisfied with the recognition results, it is possible to add further samples. Keep in mind that after retraining with more samples the recognition quality of other objects can be affected because of unbalanced sample amount in the object folder

If this object folder is ready to deploy you can freeze it now. The advantage in freezing a object folder is, that specific time consuming routines do not have to be run anymore for this object folder. You can still add further objects to this object folder, but it is possible that objects that were saved in previous training sessions are overwritten.
The object folder is already frozen. Adding further objects can cause overwriting of already learned objects!
Successfully configured object folder for further samples adding! You can now continue using the application.
Successfully learned this object! Try adding further objects!
